lines.text: [to Tim who's in a tree]
You're gonna have to come down sometime.
I'm gonna have to pee sometime and I know where I'll be aimin'.
[the Carrick boys back away]
His willie, cut off his willie.
I smashed me eggs.
They're off.
Little Con, bark.
What?
Please sir, how many swear words do you know?
What makes you think I know any?
You're grown up, me daddy knows hundreds.
Then you best put your problem to him.
Why should the poor stand in the toilets?
And all the stuff, when we get it, where will we put it?
In our HQ.
What's an HQ?
Long live the King.
It's the Queen now, it is, you moron.
Then God save the Queen.
Make him eat horse crap.
Maybe he hasnt told them yet.
He'd have to, he didnt have any clothes on.
What happened?
Geronimo. He said I looked too pleased with myself.
That's right, don't show your ugly mugs, the shock would sink our boat.
For Ballydowse and Ireland... Charge.
I'm not paying good money to stand in the toilets.
Dont hurt me, I'll tell me dad.
Tell them all what they get if they mess with the boys from Ballydowse.
By the way, what was the joke back there, I could do with a laugh?
I messed up my clothes a bit last night, and my mammy, said she'd send me to school bare-assed.
I find that prospect more horrifying than amusing.
Yes sir, but its just given me a funny idea.
Have you finished scrubbin' the paint off the old chaple board?
And what would you know about scrubbin'? You dirty bunch of knackers.
Knacker socks.
Does our mammy still wash your socks in the kitchen sink?
He doesnt have a kitchen sink.
Here come over to Carrickdowse and we'll lend you a bath.
A bath, does it have your rubber ducky in it Gorilla?
Does your mommy still powder your bum? You big girl's blouse.

[after being given some whiskey]
One for the road?
Hey lads, I think I feel a bit whoosy.
My brother, he's as drunk as a scunk.
Why did we do it?
What?
Why did we fight?
For the hell of it. What else is there?
